alert.note: Alert for Bottineau; McHenry (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 26 at 1:56PM CDT until further notice by NWS Bismarck
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Bismarck ND has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in North Dakota... Willow Creek near Willow City affecting McHenry and Bottineau Counties. .Recent snowmelt will push Willow Creek near Willow City above minor flood stage during the day Wednesday. The creek is expected to remain above minor flood stage at least through the end of this week. Chances for rain this weekend on top of melting snow could prolong flooding in this area through the weekend and possibly into next week. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Willow Creek near Willow City. * WHEN...From Wednesday afternoon until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 1440.5 feet, Creek out of banks in low spots north and west of gage. Water level just below top of culverts. At 1441.2 feet, Water begins backing up into ravines and gets to top of road by gage. At 1442.7 feet, Overflow occurs on left bank. At 1447.0 feet, County roads are closed with 3 houses cut off per Emergency Manager. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:00 PM CDT Tuesday the stage was 1441.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage, 1442.0 feet, early tomorrow afternoon and may continue rising to around 1445.2 feet by Monday morning, all of which are in minor flood stage. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Flood stage is 1442.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
